name: Nancy
etc.
review: What a gorgeous location . .. view and sunporch were wonderful. However
before I would ever rent it again
the living room furniture would have to go. So would the refrig...must be hard on electricity because of ice buildup and sweating creating possible mold and rust. Good suggestions for places to eat
pool table was fun.and the beds very comfy.
title: Nice place
but...

Wed Aug 20 2014 22:58:56 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: Michelle Jones
review: This place was mostly terrific! The overall rating and cleanliness would actually be around 4.5. I have some minor things to say about that (see below). These are the things we liked best: The beds were extremely comfortable. The pull out bed was new and supportive for a pull out. Most furniture
flooring etc. seemed new. The place was very clean and spacious. And it smelled fresh
no smoke smells or perfume smells. It was very well stocked with kitchen equipment. It had cute and convenient touches
like books about the region and games like Yatzee and Uno. We stayed seven days with our two boys. There was plenty of space for all of us

it really was much better than staying in a hotel. My husband and I enjoyed walking right out to the beach with our morning coffee while our kids played in the sand and water. We also spent time playing lawn games on their large front lawn. The fire pit was very nice and even the outdoor grills were very clean. During the time we stayed

the guests were surprisingly quiet. I did feel that the noise of leaf blowers and lawn mowers in the morning was disturbing. And there was a bull dozer on the beach for one full day of our stay. If we had been there a shorter time

this would have been a major complaint. The people next door at the Surfside Cottages were loud and had several motorized vehicles. There is a large patch of muddy marsh land between the beach and condo. There is a sandy path between
so it was not much of a problem. This little area gave us surprising returns. We saw baby frogs
different types of birds and a mother duck with her ducklings dine each evening
all on the marsh. The location of the condo is both secluded and convenient. It felt off the road and out of town enough to feel like we were  away  from things

but it was a short drive to town for groceries and fun stuff. There is also a convenience store directly across the street from the condos. We patronized them a few times for forgotten items and fire wood. Minor complaints: I feel the towels could use some washing in a little bleach. Being the area is so humid
the towels smelled a bit like  wet towel  and mildew. As did the bed pillows and fabric covered furniture. I am sensitive to mildew
so other people may not notice. We saw other guests let their dog poop on the beach and in the marsh and the dog owner did not clean it up. The noise from power tools
the bull dozer and motorized vehicles that I mentioned above would all prevent me from giving this place a 5 star rating. But I would definitely recommend this place.
Wed Aug 20 2014 22:58:56 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Great Place

Tue Aug 19 2014 03:24:39 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: kmcvey
review: This house was perfect for our family reunion in Oscoda! Our children and grandchildren thoroughly enjoyed the yard and boat dock. We loved having our boat right at the dock and took late night and early morning boat rides on the glass smooth water. Our family who live in Oscoda joined us for BBQs
smore's by the fire
and we even took our family picture in the yard! the kitchen was well equipped and there were ample towels and linens for bathing. The clothes dryer had to be replaced on the first day we were there
but Brandon did an excellent job. He was quick
very respectful
and so helpful with anything we needed. I do think the home needs a deep clean (sweeping under furniture
cleaning window screens)
and maybe some upgraded mattresses. That being said
everything was exactly as advertised. We would definitely recommend this home to future guests!
Tue Aug 19 2014 03:24:39 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Wonderful Family Reunion Cottage

Tue Aug 19 2014 00:28:56 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: Joe & Karen
Tue Aug 19 2014 00:28:56 GMT-0400 (EDT).review: House needs a lot of repairs. Could not open bedroom windows because the ripped screens would have allowed the bugs to come in. It looked like the windows had not been cleaned in a really long time. Needs more lighting - almost impossible to read with the dim lighting. Also there is a lack of lamps. Had to move one out of the bedroom to the living room. Upon arrival found the garbage pail had been knocked over and garbage was scattered on lawn. It would be nice if garbage from last tenant was removed so both garbage pails would be empty and available for the new tenant. On a positive note the water pressure was great!
Tue Aug 19 2014 00:28:56 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Moose Crossing

review: We enjoyed our stay at Big Waters. The outside area is beautiful. We loved the trees

the fire pit (which we used every night) the beach and the lake. The lake is very shallow and sandy and great for families with young kids. The house could use a few upgrades. The carpets are dirty and stained and the furniture is old. The kitchen is well stocked with just about everything you need. Mon Jul 28 2014 21:00:58 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: C Lyons
review: When booking online
it's hard to know what you're getting into
but I was so pleasantly surprised by the beautiful site and setting at Grand View #1. The whole Grand View Resort is so charming
set off the road and hidden by a row of beautiful trees. The beach is lovely
and the water is crystal clear over a rocky bottom
with no muck or seaweed to wade through. Shared firepit is really nice
and Grand Lake is beautiful. The deck is very nice
as is the landscaping. Customer service staff were friendly and immediately responsive to a clearning concern
that seems to have resulted from a miscommunication between the cleaner and the company mgt.. The cabin is spacious
has many upgrades
including a very nice kitchen
and is comfortable and a great spot for a family. The whole feeling to the resort was happy
fun
family friendly and pleasant. We made great memories and are thankful to have found such a nice place to make them. Even a storm rolling over the water was beautiful
and the wifi

new tv and spacious living room made coming in from the storm not as bad as you'd think. Central air and heating were a wonderful bonus. The lower bunk bed was surprisingly comfy. Couch could use an upgrade. Thank you
and I encourage review readers to book this place soon - it's worth it!
Mon Jul 28 2014 21:00:58 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Grand View #1

close to everything

wi-fi

MI

review: The resort is in an excellent location. The new TV and gas grills are nice
and the overall yard
lawn
fire pit
decks and general outdoors facilities are good. But
this cabin needs some TLC. The carpet in the kitchen is horribly stained - there should be vinyl flooring in a kitchen - carpet is way too hard to keep clean. The bathroom is ancient

with yucky brown stains in the sink and shower. The bedrooms are somewhat musty and the comforter cover had stains on it. The mini blinds in the living room are broken and held together with duct tape - classy. (NOT!) It would be better to throw out the mini blinds altogether or splurge $5.99 at Walmart for new ones. The couch and dining table set are good
although the dining chairs have some stains. The coffee maker heating unit did not work
so the coffee in the carafe cooled rather quickly. The stove
microwave and dishwasher are OK. The refrigerator is fairly new. This is a nice place to stay
but this cabin needs some work.

review: While we enjoyed the beach view and the comparative niceness of this beach

we could not sleep on them. No support for the very old and thin mattress and completely worthless for a night's sleep. We were also unsure when the bedding had last been washed. Also
after two moderate length showers
no hot water. We enjoyed Surf Side because it accommodated 8 family units (26 people) at the same time. If the condos were kept up better
I would recommend the site to others.

review: We wanted to let you know again how much we enjoyed the house

we hope to be back again next year!

review: The firepit
property and beach are amazing. The lake is all sand and shallow which is great for families. The house is a strange layout

lots of steps. The kitchen was nice but the furniture was really old everywhere else and the carpet was filthy. Lots of stains on walls and floor. The outside umbrella leaked and the upper deck isn't safe

OK house
Wed Jul 16 2014 01:43:45 GMT-0400 (EDT).response: Thank you so much for your feedback. We are so happy that you enjoyed the beach and what Lake Huron has to offer. We are so sorry for any concerns that you had with the home. The carpets were cleaned prior to the first guests arrival to ensure that they were in good shape for the guests. We are aware of a couple permanent carpet stains that cannot be removed and will definitely look into any others. The upstairs balcony and furniture had not been brought to our attention by previous guests but we will be more then happy to look into them. Thank you again for your review and we are so grateful to have had you as a guests!

review: We enjoyed our stay on this beautiful lake. We used our canoe and the swimming was great. The unit was adequately furnished however

Tue Jul 15 2014 04:02:38 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: Brendan Diroff
review: My friends and I are rented this place out for the weekend and had an absolute blast! The house only a few minutes away from town and was off on a side road which was quiet
peaceful

and private that was right on the lake. We loved everything about it. From the beautiful wood stairs leading to a nice loft with a comfortable futon and a bedroom with a queen size bed to the sandy backyard which leads to its' own little private beach. Everything about this place was awesome and can say we had no complaints. This place was the definition of great vacation home!

Mon Jul 14 2014 19:48:43 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: S. Gessert
review: Great house for families! Both of our grown children joined us for a 9 days of fishing and fun. We each had our own area of the house

so we could get up when we wanted and not bother late sleepers. The location right on the river was fabulous. Our family loves to fish and to have it right outside of the door was perfect. We stayed over 4th of July. The Oscoda town fireworks display was so close and we didn't have to find parking and fight crowds! We loved the fire pit for roasting marshmallows for s'mores! I marked down the cleanliness because of the blinds in the white dining area and bedroom next to it. They really need a good cleaning. Otherwise everything was fine. The beds
especially the queen off the kitchen
need to be updated with more comfortable mattresses. The towels are also in need of updating. We did not use any of the sofa sleepers
so I cannot comment on them. Because of the location and amenities
if we return to Oscoda
we would definitely stay at the AuSable River Mist.
title: Location
location
location

review: I have stayed here twice. I am a boater and an outdoorsman that normally camps and roughs it. This is a great place for the activities that I like. From this location you can canoe
kayak and fish.....whatever. Many good fisheries in a short distance like the Cooke and Foote Dam Ponds
Lake Van Etten
the Ausable and Lake Huron for those with larger boats. Also great shooting club at the old Air Force base. Skeet
trap

pistol and rifle. Very friendly and helpful club members who will give you tips on how to powder those skeet! My kids had a blast catching fish right in front of the place. review: First of all the internet pictures were quaint

but as soon as you walk in you realize that the pictures didn\'t give the whole story. The Boat House #3 was absolutely perfect and much more than we had expected. Instantly you felt right at home. It was immaculately clean. The beds were the most comfortable beds we have ever slept on and the futon was just as comfortable as the beds. The view was amazing truly. Everything you needed was supplied. The appliances were awesome and everything you need to cook with and eat on is supplied. Our family hadn\'t had a vacation in 3 years and even though the weather was cool
we had a wonderful time. We couldn\'t say enough good things about this vacation rental. The two ladies who helped with reservations
Nicole and Ashley were professional and they did their best to meet our needs from start to finish. Of course no vacation is complete without a hiccup or two... Because it was cold at night

we needed the furnace and could not get it to work (part our fault for not knowing that the pilot needed to be lit and not knowing how and part mechanical) and although an after hours number is provided for current guest and emergencies

we left two messages but didn\'t receive a call until the next day so our little ones were up \ freezing\  (their word not mine) most of the night. Nicole called first thing in the morning and Brent came out to fix the issue. He lit the pilot and showed us how to light it as well

but the blower on the furnace never worked. Nicole followed up with us to make sure we were taken care of and all of our needs were met. The customer service was truly exceptional. A quick note to the owner: The people handling your property and doing a great job. Thank you for making such an amazing place to rest and regroup. Respectfully
The Martins

review: Our week in Aug 2013 at this cottage was one of the best

most relaxing vacations we've ever had. This cottage was so roomy & comfortable on a large private property perfect to spread out with tall trees to provide shade when need be. Then there's the beach! Gorgeous clean clear Lake Huron with nice hard packed sand underneath making the trip out into deeper water a real pleasure in contrast to some of the other great lakes which force you to wade out into seaweed and slime or sharp rocks. There was hardly anyone one around at any given time so it seemed like our own private beach! Close to all the amenities in case you run out of anything
it's just 5 mins away
how convenient is that? I would recommend it to anyone looking for a relaxing get away or place for the kids to play safely while the parents chill on the beach. Looking forward to our next trip.

Thu Mar 27 2014 11:44:23 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: bcarney
review: We have stayed at Summer Wind for two years and have not been disappointed with the cottage experience. While the cottage is feels like you have been transported to the 70's

it is clean and well maintained. The screened in porch is ideal to enjoy morning coffee and all meals can be eaten at the picnic table. More important though is the wonderful beach! The sand is beautiful and expansive. The water is shallow 100's of feet and very little rocks. The view is beautiful - you can see Charity Island and freighters come and go into the bay. There is a bonfire pit for evening campfires. There is a nice grassy backyard with trees for shade.

Thu Mar 27 2014 11:42:19 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: Danasytek
review: Our family has stayed at Summer Wind for several years now. The house is situated directly on Lake Huron with beautiful views and a lovely sandy beach. Hanging out on the beach is what we like to do most of the time. The water right out front is shallow enough to set your beach chairs in while you watch the little ones play. If you want to escape the summer sun there is a nice shade tree to sit under
which is closer to the house
also on the beach side. A couple of other conveniences
just to name a few
are the washer/dryer
dishwasher
and the screened-in porch for rainy days.
Thu Mar 27 2014 11:42:19 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Summer Wind...Great vacation spot

Thu Mar 27 2014 11:29:07 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: sabnina
review: Hurondezvous was really perfect for our vacation. We had three generations staying together
and there was room for everyone. The location was far enough away from the tourist trap-ish area to be pleasantly quiet

but not too far to drive when we wanted to take advantage of the amenities. I was pleasantly surprised when we walked in that the house looked nicer than it had looked in the photos - it's always hard to tell. We adored the beach - Hurondezvous has one of the nicest stretches of beach in the neighborhood! It is deeper than most from the house to the water
and the sand was soft near the house. We played frisbee
took walks
and waded in the shallow water (we felt the water was a little too cold for us to go swimming while we were there in August

although some other people were). It's a beautiful view from the house and the porch! The screened-in porch and deck were so nice. We also adored the pool table! It received nearly constant use for the 6 days we stayed. We did have trouble with the oven at the beginning of our stay
but it was corrected and we were able to bake a cake for my son's birthday. We also used the grill a few times
which was nice. The kitchen was well-stocked - dishes for 8 (exactly what we needed) and plenty of pots & pans. We had a wonderful stay at Hurondezvous
and we all hated to have to leave! I wouldn't hesitate at all to recommend this rental!
Thu Mar 27 2014 11:29:07 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: sabnina

Thu Mar 27 2014 11:27:17 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: amorgan
review: good location

nice and spacious. very dusty and smelled musty and of mildew. rusty water with a sulfur smell. owner could put in a water softener to help with the smell and rust stains in tub. spent the weekend on benydryl for allergies. I am not sure what it was that made them flare up
could have been dust
pet dander
or mildew. I was not aware the property was for sale and had a visit from a reality company. when we did not let them in to show
they went all around the yard and house peering in windows as we vacationed. It was a little unsettling
however with that said
we overall had a relaxing time
and a nice get away. we have been renting with Perfect landing for years
and always satisfied with them. will continue to rent from them
maybe not this place
but they have many that are very nice!

in terms of the location
the beautiful sunrises
and the space that this cottage offered for our family of 4. However
my daughter has pretty severe allergies and her skin issues flared up tremendously staying here. The basics were cleaned
linens were fine

but there was a LOT of dust. There was also water damage behind the walls that may have contributed to the mildewy smell. This cottage is also quite a drive from a grocery store or restaurants. However
it has beautiful beaches and outside surroundings

review: The home was clean and came with all the amenities! Kitchen was well stocked for cooking with utensils
pots
pans

games
even sand/water toys
for the kids! The beach was beautiful and well groomed! The walk out to the beach is long and steep
which can be hard if you have any physical limitations. Also
on hot days
the sand gets hot for the little ones while walking
so bring your sandals! We stayed while there was construction going on out front
which woke us up early a few mornings
but it turned out ok! The view was wonderful and we loved our stay!
Thu Mar 27 2014 11:23:13 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Nichole1579

Thu Mar 27 2014 11:22:01 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: psnarey
review: the home on lake huron was outstanding. the kitchen was so new and well equiped for a family that really likes to cook. it had double ovens
a dishwasher
and every utensil we needed. the living
dining
and kitchen was open concept and opened onto double french doors and an outside deck that overlooked the beach. this beach was so family friendly. no weeds
no rocks

and a very gentle depth that worked for little children to play in the water without worring about drop offs. the bedrooms and bathrooms were well equiped with ceiling fans in each room and airconditioning in the master suite. 2 bathrooms on this main level and 1 bathroom on the lower level. we liked it so much that we will return for another family visit. also the neighbors were very friendly and helpful with questions we ask about the area. very thums up from our family. perfect landing agent ben made our visit so comfortable
he even had wood delivered for our bonfires. working with perfect landing was an outstanding experience.
Thu Mar 27 2014 11:22:01 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: huron calling between augres and tawas

Thu Mar 27 2014 11:17:32 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: Charity*GR
review: This was our first experience staying at Presque Isle and we loved it. We stumbled upon this economic gem on a great property. A communal fire pit made making friends easy
but if you're looking for privacy this won't be for you. The motel units look directly at the cabins with a slice of lake between. Wish more detailed cleaning had occured prior to our stay
the moldy ceiling in the kitchen can't be safe. We were however pleasantly surprised by the furnished kitchen items which made making meals in house feasible. ((no DVD player as listed and no cable
internet) We would stay here again as it is convenient to other adventures.
Thu Mar 27 2014 11:17:32 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Mixed review

Thu Mar 27 2014 11:15:06 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: Chacha
review: There is a view of Grand Lake from the porch of this unit with a direct path between the cabins. Pleasantly surprised at the provided applicances (blender
toaster
fans) as well as all the necessary dishes for meal making. Unit 6 did not have a DVD player (plan accordingly) and only received 2 channels
although who needs TV when you have a lake. It was necessary to air it out as it smelled like there's a mold/mildew issue coming from the kitchen area. Also
we couldn't get the AC or heat to work. For the price we were sufficiently happy with it.

Thu Mar 27 2014 11:11:23 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: goldenluke
Thu Mar 27 2014 11:11:23 GMT-0400 (EDT).review: Stayed at this Cabins many times and overall they are fine for the price. The only complaint are the TV's. They are very outdated and the picture is very fuzzy. In Cabin 4 the longer you watched the TV the worse the picture got until it was all fuzz. You would then have to turn the TV off and wait several hours until you could watch it again.
Thu Mar 27 2014 11:11:23 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: goldenluke

Thu Mar 27 2014 11:06:21 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: CoreenaSchroyer
review: This was a great place to stay
nice and quiet with a beautiful view! We found plenty to explore and our dogs loved the open area. The gas grill available was a wonderful addition
there is nothing like a grilled meal with a gorgeous view.
Thu Mar 27 2014 11:06:21 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Great place to stay

Thu Mar 27 2014 11:00:29 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: Opjuvi
review: Location was easy to find. We came at night so the only problem was there was no light in the parking \ area\ . No parking lines to go by so we just parked where and how we wanted. The cottage was small but had everything we needed. The one thing we were unsure of was the use of the washer and dryer. We didn\'t need to use them but had no clue as to where to go if we did. The booklet in the cottage offers the use of one for $1 each load but no say as to where they are located. The booklet also asks you to stay in the common areas but it would help if they mapped it out. The only fire pit we saw was the one on the far right side by cottage #5. One fire pit for all cottages
not cool. We stayed from Friday night to Monday afternoon. We saw no one the whole weekend
no one in the office at all. We thought that was a tad strange. Regardless of those few minor things
we really enjoyed our time here. Worth the time and money for a family get away!!
Thu Mar 27 2014 11:00:29 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Opjuvi

Thu Mar 27 2014 10:55:29 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: sminda
review: This rental house was PERFECT!! We live in Texas and decided to get married in Oscoda. We had so many friends flying in for the wedding we decided to rent Far Far Away. We had bon fires every night
BBQs
and had plenty of room for everyone to sleep! It was ideal!! it came with all the dishes and utensils we needed so it was so easy! We really couldn't have been happier
Thu Mar 27 2014 10:55:29 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: THE PERFECT RENTAL HOUSE

Thu Mar 27 2014 10:46:18 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: ljordan
review: My husband and I were able to stay here for our unofficial  honeymoon  and it was amazing!!! Of course my husband loved being able to fish in the pond and I must admit I enjoyed it a myself just for the fact that at Enchanted Evenings I could actually catch fish. . . and they were the biggest blue gills and perch me or my husband had ever seen! Our favorite aspect of this beautiful home was the location. There were no neighbors around and it's off the main road far enough to be secluded while it's still a straight shot to get to town. We had the huge amount of property all to ourselves. When we were outside we didn't have to worry about being bothered. %100 quality alone time. But when we needed something town was only a 10 or 15 minute drive. Inside of the house is also very accommodating and clean. The kitchen had everything we needed for indoor and outdoor cooking; the living room furniture was both comfy and big enough for both my hubby and I to cuddle up and catch a movie on the flat screen; the bedroom overlooks the property which was very "enchanting" when waking up in the morning- it makes you feel rich!; even the basement has some cool decor to keep you entertained if you enjoy some up close wild life! In fact
on top of the  luxuries  this house has

everywhere you look there is some fascinating souvenir from a far away place or special memorabilia to keep you entertained. This house made the memory of our  honeymoon ! Anywhere else we would have stayed in the area would have just been somewhere to stay while we honeymooned. "Enchanted Evenings" created the experience and we are so grateful for the opportunity to stay in this amazing house!
Thu Mar 27 2014 10:46:18 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Don't Miss Out on this AMAZING House

Thu Mar 27 2014 10:44:49 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: Trishaanne7
review: We utilize Enchanted Evenings for a girls weekend. This weekend was already a coveted and cherished time for the 7 to 10 of us that go every year
but this place made it all the more so! The trails
the privacy
the host/owner was the stellar charm of the place! He shared his space
some veggies from the garden and his time with us. We were beyond grateful. Enchanted Evenings was clean
open and inviting. The view in the mornings was fantastic and remained that way the entire time we were there. The deck is huge
the amenities on the deck (grill

furniture) were perfectly suited to our needs. And the space inside was comfortable if we got to hot or too cold. We had 9 of us there and all of us had plenty of room to roam. The evenings were SO QUIET and the stars lit the way for us to see beauty in every direction. We sat by the stream after walking thru the trails and it was heavenly (to use the biggest word I can think of to describe). We also had a couple of girls who fished in the pond - and we saw a swamp monster (massive turtle) that we created entire stories around in the evenings by the fire pit. AND THAT SHOWER!!! Personally
I missed that shower for a good month after I went back home to my own. NICE! We will be returning every year! Special thanks to Dennis for creating such a place and being so willing to share it.
Thu Mar 27 2014 10:44:49 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Enchanted Time

Thu Mar 27 2014 10:39:00 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: Sailor
Thu Mar 27 2014 10:39:00 GMT-0400 (EDT).review: My husband and I enjoyed our 3 night stays at "Dancing with Waves" during the summer of 2012. The view of Lake Huron was mesmerizing. We had a nice romantic time with peace and quiet tranquility.
Thu Mar 27 2014 10:39:00 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Sailor

Thu Mar 27 2014 07:56:16 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: tonybelton
review: For the second year in a row my family and I have come up from Fort Wayne

IN to stay with Perfect Landing and try a different abode each time. Each year gets better and better and staying at Big Waters was no let down. The secluded cabin and private beach of Lake Huron was just what I needed to find some peace and relaxation from the everyday stress of life. Only having the opportunity to do this once a year is far too less so we will definitely be coming back next summer and hopefully multiple times.
Thu Mar 27 2014 07:56:16 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Good times in great home

Thu Mar 27 2014 06:58:07 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: slomas
review: Don't let the low score on cleanliness fool you. I only rated it low because when we arrived it hadn't been cleaned. One phone call to Nichole and she got the ball rolling. After waiting about 2.5 hours
the house was cleaned and ready for us. We would certainly return.
Thu Mar 27 2014 06:58:07 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Nice

Thu Mar 27 2014 06:55:22 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: akolbusz
review: Very clean & modern home
the AC worked perfectly. We were able to house 3 generations of family
with a total of 9 people ranging from 3 yrs old to 87 yrs old. The only issues we had were that the upstair's Family Room hide away was not comfortable
and a dishwasher would've made things easier. My husband loved the proximity to the ORV trails
very convenient. Also
plenty of parking for the  toys.
Thu Mar 27 2014 06:55:22 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: akolbusz

Thu Mar 27 2014 06:53:56 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: weekender
review: We came up to Oscoda for a quick getaway

and it was an amazing time! There is an awesome bar/restaurant within walking distance just across the river. There is a hot tub that really lets you unwind. There is a huge living room on the second floor that overlooks the AuSable river and its so peaceful to sit back
relax and enjoy the wildlife float down the river. Everything in the home is very classy and well put together. We will be back!
Thu Mar 27 2014 06:53:56 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Beautiful View

Thu Mar 27 2014 06:52:35 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: dandoan88
Thu Mar 27 2014 06:52:35 GMT-0400 (EDT).review: We had a great stay. This home is wonderful. The location being on the river was amazing. We would stay here again and I highly recommend it to everyone.
Thu Mar 27 2014 06:52:35 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Great Weekend Stay

Thu Mar 27 2014 06:27:14 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: Frisinger
review: My family and I have been renting in the Tawas area for 14 years. We tried a new cottage this year
peace of heaven

and we could not have been more pleased! We could fished on Floyd Lake and swam and boated on Sand Lake. Sand lake is just gorgeous. The children spent hours a day in the lake and sand. The house was great-a bigger kitchen than I have at home! The washer and dryer were so convenient. The kids loved the outdoor play equipment. We all enjoyed the enormous fire pit. Next year we plan to rent both the house and the apartment above the garage and invite extended family.
Thu Mar 27 2014 06:27:14 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: It was our peace of heaven this summer

Thu Mar 27 2014 06:26:09 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: LAnderson
review: We stayed at Peace of Heaven Units #1 and #2 in July for our annual family reunion and had a fantastic time!! The homes were very clean and neat
especially the larger unit. We loved the large yard where we enjoyed croquet
bean bag toss games

and relaxing in the sun. The close beach at the end of the drive was awesome!! Spent some fun afternoons in the sun and water!! Enjoyed some large bonfires in the backyard too. It was truly a beautiful
relaxing place and we would definitely return. I would highly recommend this vacation spot - especially for families with young children as there were lots of toys
sandbox
merry-go-round
and fun things to enjoy!
Thu Mar 27 2014 06:26:09 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: LAnderson

Thu Mar 27 2014 06:21:36 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: Shelly
review: This house is in a fantastic location! It's actually located between 2 lakes and has 2 beaches! Also
it was just a short drive to go into Tawas City and see Lake Huron also. The smaller lake was a great fishing lake for the guys

and the girls loved the beautiful sandy beaches. The house is very nice and nicely decorated and had a full kitchen so we felt like we were at home. We will definately make this our yearly family vacation spot. Also

there was a lot of property/woods around the home so that the kids had a ball exploring! There was always something fun to do for our family! I would highly recommend this vacation spot to a friend or family member.
Thu Mar 27 2014 06:21:36 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: We loved it! What an awesome vacation place!

Wed Mar 26 2014 14:41:38 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: jjp6
review: Since my previous post (March
2013) we had the opportunity to again stay at Enchanted Evenings (EE) this June and also August

2013. We were not disappointed on either visit! The June (3-day) visit included four grand children and two adults and the August visit had four adults. This place more than accommodated all of us. The kitchen was well equipped for preparing all meals (including zip lock omelets for breakfast) and a place for the grandkids to place sand-lot baseball! Fishing was as good or better than last year. Although EE is a few miles from Oscoda
we did not find this to be a problem. Away for the city

waking up in the morning morning we saw plentiful deer right outside the window. The enormous garden (no chemicals) was a pleasant surprise and very much appreciated as the vegetables complimented our meals (you don't get this benefit at a hotel or motel). The peace and serenity cannot matched. We highly recommend EE for the young and old and we very much look forward to coming back in 2014!
Wed Mar 26 2014 14:41:38 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Repeat Visits (2013)

Wed Mar 26 2014 14:39:45 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: marielandkevinculp
review: My now Husband and I had an enchanted stay in June 2013
after my Husband and I got married
we had all of our family come up and visit and celebrate with us. We had bonfires
listened to music
played ladder ball
walked around the property
and MORE! It was so nice to just relax and be in such a beautiful environment. Well worth the money

and the couple days we spent there. We already want to go back! The shower was AMAZING! I found myself taking 2 showers a day because it was just so nice! The kitchen was also so gorgeous. Pretty much everything about this place was amazing. The only thing I didn't care TOO much for was the location of being so far into the country
people who were coming to visit
couldn't find it on there gps which made finding the place alot harder. Which I guess is also a good thing
since people don't bother you
and you are in the middle of the woods! All in all

I want to go back as soon as possible to this gorgeous home! Thank you Amy for finding this home for me as an after wedding celebration. Also thank you Dennis for letting us stay in your beautiful home! Hope to be back soon!
Wed Mar 26 2014 14:39:45 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: My enchanted summer after wedding celebration

Wed Mar 26 2014 14:37:29 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: wolters1@yahoo.com
review: With more than enough room for our group of 8 guys
we had more than enough room. The Enchanted Evenings property was clean
high class and the open space (both inside and out) meant we were not crammed into a small space for the guys weekend of eating

fishing and storytelling. The trails are amazing and envied by all of us that hunt as there is so much wildlife to see while sitting near the fire. We of course had a blast with the fish pond and recommend everyone drop a line in as the fish are plentiful! Although the kitchen was huge and ready to roll

we took a quick drive down the road and enjoyed some great local cooking. The locals welcomed us as had great stories to share. With such a great home on a great spot you can only expect to be spoiled by what Dennis has built. A must for the guys to get out of the city
have nature and fishing while sleeping in style before returning to the rat race of family life. It is a true rarity to find all this without having to hike it and sleep on the ground in a tent
Wed Mar 26 2014 14:37:29 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Guys Weekend Getaway - all in one place

Wed Mar 26 2014 14:35:44 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: jjp6
review: Grandpa

watch out for the flock of turkeys!‚Äù my granddaughter shirked as we slowly turned off the main highway onto the private road leading to Enchanted Evenings. What a pleasant surprise as we began our fantastic three day stay there last June! Enough cannot be said about this beautiful place and its surroundings. The well-furnished home sets on a hill that overlooks a peaceful meandering trout stream and fields of grain where we watched the deer wandering about. A short walk over the bridge brought us to a pond stocked with various types of pan fish. Equipped with their cane-poles and bait
my three grandchildren could not wait to see who would catch the biggest and the most fish during our visit (Joe won with about 22

closely followed by Anna and Renee.) The groomed hiking trails (maps provided) led us through the pines and hardwoods where a dray of squirrels chattered nervously as we passed by them. In the evening
we sang songs by the bonfire
roasted hotdogs and feasted on S‚Äômores. Before turning in
we listened to the crickets and other enchanting sounds of the night
and marveled at the beauty of the night sky with its many stars not seen in the city. Our stay at Enchanted Evenings was truly a rich and rewarding experience
with cherished memories that we will not forget. As we departed
I promised the grandkids that we will be back. And
with any luck
the turkeys will again greet us upon our arrival.
Wed Mar 26 2014 14:35:44 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Enchanted Evenings - A Must for the Young and Old

Wed Mar 26 2014 14:34:18 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: lbgogreen@aol.com
review: We went to this lovely place August of 2011. We went with our 2 sons one in his 20's and one a teenager. We all loved it. One son loves to cook and he totally enjoyed the kitchen and how pleasant it was to cook in. I enjoyed how easy it was to clean up! It is away from everyone and so peaceful. One son is a runner
so he loved going out on the trails. My husband and I enjoyed walking the trails. The boys enjoyed fishing. It was just wonderful. We couldn't get the family together last year

but we are going back this year and we can't wait!!! We appreciated the veggies from the garden. The best part was how clean it was. If you are looking for secluded peace and quiet this is it! Thanks!
Wed Mar 26 2014 14:34:18 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Love Enchanted Evening

Wed Mar 26 2014 14:18:41 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: nchambers
review: 8 of us stayed here for our annual canoe/tubing trip and we could not have been happier. We had a campfire in the designated pit until it started raining
and then we moved everyone inside for board games and cards. There was more than enough room for us
inside and out. It's private enough to feel like you're up north
but not secluded or too far removed. Quick drive to the Oscoda Canoe Livery
which was perfect. The place was very clean
including the hot tub and grill outside
and the basics (kitchenware
etc.) were provided which was a huge help. We will definitely keep this on our list of options for 2014 and beyond.
Wed Mar 26 2014 14:18:41 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Great Getaway

Wed Mar 26 2014 14:16:31 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: pcamper
review: 4 of us stayed here for a week in early spring and found this home to be comfortable. We were happy to be able to have our dogs on vacation with us. We were told we could dock our boat along the boardwalk
but that wasn't possible due to rocks along shore. I see they've updated the picture of the shoreline to show the rocks. Cabin seemed as if it hadn't been cleaned
but we cleaned it ourselves and let the agency know the housekeeper hadn't taken out trash etc. we received no response. We might consider staying again but would prefer a home with a dock.
Wed Mar 26 2014 14:16:31 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: pcamper

Wed Mar 26 2014 14:13:38 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: hokuro_3
review: This place was the best place I have ever vacationed in my life! Literally everything you need to relax is at this place. Lumberman's monument and Iargo springs aren't far at all either! Beautiful yard
beautiful house. This is my new favorite motivational thing to go to work for... so I can save up some money to come back here!!!
Wed Mar 26 2014 14:13:38 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Best place ever

Wed Mar 26 2014 14:12:18 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: c_richh
review: This place is absolutely phenomenal. I stayed at this house last week with my fiance. The location is awesome and the house is VERY cool. We enjoyed having bonfires at night in the fire pit
and cooking on the stone grill next to it. We caught a HUGE catfish right off of the boardwalk! This was our second time staying here ( We actually got engaged here!)
and it will definitely not be the last!!! We are already planning
and ANXIOUSLY awaiting our trip for next year!
Wed Mar 26 2014 14:12:18 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Amazing

Wed Mar 26 2014 14:10:50 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: fpoissant
review: This is the first time my family has rented a cottage for vacation
but it definitely won't be the last! There were eight of us in total
plus 2 dogs
so there was plenty of room for sleeping
hanging out and getting around. The back porch was a very popular destination in the morning. Having the river right there was nice

and a few of our folks even took the plunge into the river from the boardwalk! The fire pit was positioned well and we really liked having both the charcoal grill and the gas grill for cooking. We had a great experience with this holiday weekend getaway and we're already looking forward to planning next year's trip!
Wed Mar 26 2014 14:10:50 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Labor Day Weekend 2013

Wed Mar 26 2014 14:08:45 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: Lisa P
Wed Mar 26 2014 14:08:45 GMT-0400 (EDT).review: 4th of July Get Away I like that the home was pet friendly. It was spacious and had a nice view of the river. My teenagers enjoyed the hot tub. The only complaint I have is that the grill was extremely dirty so my family was unable to use it. But overall we enjoyed our stay and the price was affordable.
Wed Mar 26 2014 14:08:45 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Ausable River Home

Wed Mar 26 2014 14:06:05 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: JMWarner
review: The time spent at AuSable Riverhome was outstanding. The home is beautiful and with the kitchen open and centerally located so even the cook can enjoy the river sights along with the people inside and out. The home was peaceful

comfortable and charming.The host thought of everything to make our stay welcomed. Very clean. Being able to bring along our little Shi Tzu and to toss in a fishing line was a plus. Fireplaces in both sitting areas make it nice for the reader or TV watcher
or simply a place to visit. The low table by the windows is a real magnetic place to read the paper
play a game

or relax with a cup of coffee along with your morning devotional. We needed a time of rest a relaxation and we found it here at the AuSable Riverhome. We will deffinately come back again. Thank you for your thoughtful ness in making our stay comfortable.
Wed Mar 26 2014 14:06:05 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Our 28 Wedding Aniversary Getaway

Wed Mar 26 2014 14:03:23 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: Buddy2012
review: We stayed at AuSable River Home for 5 days with two teenagers over Fourth of July weekend. The location is close to everything: restaurants
beach
canoeing

etc. Teens rode bikes all over the place. Teens spent many hours getting a tan out on the boardwalk right in the backyard. We watched the fireworks from the boardwalk also. Real advantages for us were pet-friendly and a rental that can be scheduled for less than a full week. Very spacious for the 4 of us. Lots to do within driving distance also.
Wed Mar 26 2014 14:03:23 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: We would definitely come back again

Wed Mar 26 2014 14:01:27 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: jddonnelly
review: We were looking for a vacation place for a long weekend to go with 4 adults and two teenagers that wasn't too expensive since it was and  end of the year treat . We also needed a place that allowed our dog to join. We went at the end of August 2012. This was the perfect place. The kids enjoyed fishing off of the boardwalk area. We brought our own outdoor games (hillbilly golf) and enjoyed playing it at night in the nice yard while watching the ducks float by. They had a ton of items in the garage for the kids to play with. The main area and kitchen were really spacious so we enjoyed playing cards around the table while the kids watched a movie in the TV area. We also enjoyed cooking out and relaxing inside the screened in patio. It was clean
and cute
and a nice trip. The surrounding area was very quaint and scenic. It was like a mini beach town. We shopped a lot
rented a pontoon boat (this was a favorite for the kids) and enjoyed the nice weather. We had pizza in town (I forget the name of the place) and it was some of the best pizza I've ever had. Very nice
low key getaway for families. Not a crazy party type situation
but that's what we were looking for. It's not a five star resort
but a very quaint place - especially for the price. I actually returned from the trip WITH money....that never happens! I recommend this place to anyone looking for a fun
relaxing getaway at an affordable price! (PS - the hot tub was very relaxing too)
Wed Mar 26 2014 14:01:27 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Great home for a great price

Wed Mar 26 2014 13:59:51 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: A Bud
review: My family has been coming to the AuSable home for over ten years. We love the fact that it is a turn key home with everything you need right there! We enjoy fishing off the pier
taking our son to the small park next door and venturing to downtown Tawas for it's many events

shops and resturaunts. We also love the fact that this is a dog friendly cottage with a BEAUTIFUL dog friendly beach located not even 3 blocks away so Rover can always come to! There is no shortage of amenities including the all important wifi and cable along with a hot tub. We love playing cards and board games in front of the large glass windows while watching the ducks glide down the river. It is truly a great location and we always find something new and exciting to do. This year maybe a fishing tour or kayaking! We can't wait to return!
Wed Mar 26 2014 13:59:51 GMT-0400 (EDT).title: Great family vacation home

Wed Mar 26 2014 13:56:57 GMT-0400 (EDT).name: dakota49
review: I was looking for an affordable place for a mini-vacation and stumbled upon the AuSable Riverhome (Sept 2012). What I initially liked is how affordable it was and the amount of people who can stay. They have a lot of great amenities here including a washer and dryer and a hot tub; which got a lot of use. We were able to have a fire in the fire pit
relax on the log swings
make dinners
and just enjoy everything the Oscoda area had to offer. The indoor furniture is a little dated looking

but it is in good condition and clean. My only complaint was the water pressure in the shower (which I had been told was fixed after my last visit). We had an amazing mini-vacation thanks to this place and we are looking to back later this year. Great find and great deal.
